text: Nick Stokes, Gil Grissom, Las Vegas Crime Lab.
You want to tell us what's going on?
You don't have to talk to us.
Blood settled at the time of death.
Body's been moved from the murder scene.
Sorry, guys. I lost you at the fork.
Let's process this guy shall we?
Officer, would you uncuff him, please?!
Okay, make like a scarecrow for me, partner.
Arms out, away from your body.
That's it. Stay just like that.
tag that body for special processing, VIP room.
Don't wash it till I get there, and don't touch his fingernails.
Employee walked in to get towels...
A young woman, healthy, just reading a magazine and all of a sudden she DFOs?
That's what the night manager says.
just getting some towels and I walked in and she was there.
Well, it looks as if the sash may have been tied by somebody else.
you know anything about redressing the body?
I-I-I thought she should be covered.
Did you move the body here, too?
I put a robe on her.
It's not like it's a crime or anything.
Makes us doubt the circumstances surrounding the victim's death.
Trace will probably have a better idea.
I'll get DNA to see if there's bits of Ben under the fingernails.
You told me to wait for you.
Well, that hasn't stopped you yet.
I did observe some fibers in the wound.
Ms. Marita, did the deceased use the Jacuzzi facilities this evening?
Well, you lied to us before.
It's, uh, not uncommon to drown in a Jacuzzi.
Hair gets caught in the whirl a person gets dragged under.
The hotel wouldn't be considered unsafe.
She did not drown on these premises.
Well, if she did, the coroner would find water in her lungs but it'd be worse hearing it from him than from you.
Oliver Dunne; corporate lawyer, father of two.
You get all that from his dentals?
She came down to I.D. his property.
Last one I recovered entered through his abdominals pierced the liver, lodged in the oblique.
That's not what killed him, is it?
We pulled a yellow fiber out of the neck wound.
I think it's from his tie.
Without oxygen, the alveoli capillaries wither and dry up.
What you may have here is the smallest sliver of the murder weapon.
Why would a guy shoot a man three times and then strangle him with his own tie?
I cannot tell you why but I might be able to tell you where.
The flour on Oliver Dunne has a low gluten content-- seven percent protein-- it's typical of flour used to make cakes, pizzas, that kind of thing.
So, why did you rule out bakeries?
Well, the subtype of flour is another subtype; double zero.
It's a very fine flour used only in pizza-baking ovens.
Oh, and Trace picked up some oregano in the sample.
When are you set to interview Ben?
You're the registered owner of a Lorcin .380.
Takes the same caliber bullet as the slugs we took out of the victim.
So, I'm going to ask you one more time where's your gun?
Do you think we believe that?
it's a place called Dante's Pizzeria.
It's too hot back there with all the ovens and stuff.
ever come into contact with the baking flour at Dante's?
Well, 'cause we found flour on the victim and it's the kind that's used to make pizza.
Ben, why don't you earn yourself some points by telling me what the science is going to tell me anyway?
Well, I don't have to talk.
No... but we're going to figure it out.
Look, if you know so much about these murders what do you need me for?
I feel like I'm mowing a lawn.
What is that? A beer can?
Any more bodies you want to tell me about?
We're going to radar this whole hillside.
Sometimes... when I leave a crime scene where I've been particularly involved with a dead body I sit in my car and it hits me-- how close I was...
Oh, I hope that's Shelley Danvers the woman from the hotel spa.
You guys finished with day-shift runover, huh?
I hate it when you CSI guys get territorial.
Yeah, well, the victims' families hate it when we don't.
I'll take it from here, David.
No serosanguineous fluid expunged from the mouth or nose.
Bright red lividity extending down the body.
Stroke could cause multiple organ failure and if I'm right...
Hey, I still have to do the post. Catherine?
Brass, I need you to get records from that hotel spa-- a warrant, if we need it.
Yeah. Was our girl staying with anyone at that hotel?
Best friends from Terre Haute, Indiana.
Flew here in a package. Why?
We need someone to give us the truth about last night.
Benjamin's a member of my parish.
The officer won't let me talk to him.
He said you were in charge.
Ah... then you'd have no problem with my talking to him.
I wouldn't expect anything less. 11th hour?
When the reality of their actions set in they usually turn to religion.
Can you think of a better time?
See if this laceration on this guy's forehead is consistent with the kid's shovel.
A 25-year-old Latino and a 42-year-old white guy?
Doesn't make sense. There's no connection.
Well, it obviously wasn't a robbery.
What's the matter, man-- A.C. not working?
Oliver Dunne's car was just found by the Highway Patrol abandoned at an AvCon station off 215.
They didn't happen to find another car there, did they?
And you can verify that when Shelley went to the hotel spa last night she was going to use the dry sauna?
We'd been drinking apple martinis for three days straight.
Shelley said the sauna would detox her you know, clean her out.
Mine. Shelley and I got in a fight over it.
I caught her trying it on and I said Give it back, and then we started fighting over it, you know, tug of war and the whole thing ripped right in two.
I'd give anything to have her back.
We're going to take this shirt, if you don't mind.
No, go ahead, if it'll help.
You said you have proof that Shelley used the dry sauna.
She called down from this phone.
Do they tape phone calls here?
You're sure she used that phone to make the appointment?
We're going to take this as well.
Okay... but it doesn't have anything on it.
Two men were shot and killed and you didn't see anything?
You don't just miss something like that. What was going on?
A friend of mine came with his new car.
We took it for a drive.
I'm afraid my boss will find out.
I was only gone five minutes.
When did you know there'd been a crime committed?
Well, my buddy dropped me back here and I noticed these two cars.
I went to check them out.
They told me out front I'd find you here.
I don't see your, uh... visitor's badge.
What makes you think, uh... I was ever a Catholic?
First time we met, you called me Father.
Everybody else, it's Reverend or Minister.
I wanted to know how your investigation against Ben is going.
You know, you really shouldn't be here.
I didn't come here to tamper with your evidence.
He was a good kid, all through school.
Still comes to Mass every Sunday.
This Luminol reveals any dried blood spots.
To whom much is given, much will be expected.
I leave you to your work.
I told you we have no record Shelley Danvers specifically used the dry sauna.
ESDA can read this blank paper see what's written on it.
Sometimes a simple flashlight will do the trick.
So she took a dry sauna.
She died of a heat stroke.
The Coroner just called in with the results of his final post.
Your sauna's kept in the optimal condition for heat stroke-- 182 Â°F.
That could kill a person if you left them longer than two straight hours.
Especially if no one checks up on them.
A hotel employee is supposed to check on the various saunas every 15 minutes.
We, uh, we got a copy of the check-up sheet.
You moved her into the locker room?
I was just trying to protect the hotel.
They drill into us that the reputation of this hotel is everything.
Pump jockey wasn't very helpful but bullets pulled from Victim One and Victim Two.
Bullets in both victims were fired by the exact same weapon.
The same pistol registered to a Benjamin Jennings.
P.D. can prove through credit cards that Ben frequents the AvCon gas stations where both vics were killed.
And we can prove he transported those bodies in his vehicle based on the blood you found.
I recovered a burgundy fiber from the sock of Victim One.
Found the same fiber on the sock of Victim Two.
We ID'd the fibers using the FTIR.
It's a polymer commonly used in vehicle carpeting.
So we went back to Ben's car.
We got the Master Standards from the car manufacturer.
The assigned name for the material is 12-ounce Merlot Trialon.
Show me the gun with Ben's prints on it.
Gun shot residue, the ligature, the...
The holes in Christ's hands, Doubting Thomas?
St. Thomas was ahead of us all.
Does this have anything to do with the priest that's been coming around here?
It has to do with the evidence.
It's our job to present the D.A. with the best evidence possible.
The evidence doesn't get any better than this.
I'm up for a shower and tucking my daughter in.
Well, I guess I'll go see Tina alone.
Hotel tells me she's down playing quarter slots.
I thought we solved this case.
Well, my guy in the hotel lounge tells me that Tina and Shelley were having a catfight over some dude named Jeremy the day she died.
That's probably how the shirt really got ripped.
Don't ring her bell till we re-examine our case.
I looked deeper into the evidence.
I should have looked deeper into Ben's character.
Past convictions, breaking and entering assault with great bodily harm.
He's looking at his third strike here.
You know how we pushed him to file on Ben?
We know that you only buried the bodies.
Did you learn to throw pizzas in prison, Roger?
Who the hell are you guys?
Roger Jennings-- armed robbery, breaking and entering.
You sound like the kind of guy it wouldn't be a big jump to murder.
Your first stop the AvCon gas station.
Don't know what you're talking about.
My little brother got me this job.
Suppose I told you your brother said you did these guys.
You did it directly after work using a .380 pistol and then you strangled one of the victims with his own tie.
Look what I did-- I just lost my head.
What am I supposed to do now?
I'm on a short line, all right?
Roger, you've got to help me.
What am I going to do?
You got to deal with it.
What started the beef with the victims?
Hey, man! I was here first.
You want to wait your turn?
What are you going to do, huh?
Bystander gets a little too nosy...
The perpetrator's hands left flour on the victim's face.
This was not from a gunshot.
This was something a little more intimate.
When a person changes his mode of murder from pistol to ligature it's for one of two reasons-- entertainment... or necessity.
I told you, Ben strangled that guy.
I don't know what you're talking about.
Anything on the list besides the tie?
You can go ahead and take off.
This man's not as smart as he thinks.
Dry cleaning bakes in blood stains.
I'm just trying to put our mistake to good use.
check the perimeter and I'll see if we have blood stains or red sauce.
Is the printer out of ink?
The dry cleaning baked in the blood and it also degraded it to a degree that I can't get a result.
Try again. This could be victim blood. Try again.
There's no way I can say that the bullets taken from the victims were fired by Jennings's gun.
So, he altered the barrel somehow.
Yeah. Changed how the bullet relates to the barrel so when the bullet emerges, its fine stria are altered.
We present this to the D.A.
Unfortunately, we've had this discussion before.
The guilty brother's going to walk.
He's never been in any real trouble before.
The bullet jammed in the feed, didn't it?
Wait, are you saying Shelley didn't die in the sauna?
But the stroke covered up an underlying medical catastrophe.
Coroner says some of the indicators renal failure, cerebral edema.
We missed it until Captain Brass brought your room service records to our attention.
Well, maybe this will help-- the travel agency contract you and Shelley signed.
Under allergic reactions to foods for Shelley Danvers-- shellfish.
As her best friend, you would know that.
And then we have this from the hotel computer for your room 01 p.m., on the day A Taste from the Sea a lovely tureen of mild bisque with pureed bits of Maine lobster.
She didn't know what she was eating when it arrived, did she?
Because she didn't order it; you did.
We've got a machine known as the ESDA machine which can read pen imprints.
Were you in the room when Jeremy called?
You killed her over a guy you two met at a bar?
I didn't mean to kill her.
I thought that she would just have an allergic reaction and she wouldn't be able to make her date that night like, get hives or something.
Well, her allergy kicked in in the sauna under the worst possible conditions-- trachea... larynx... tongue swelled.
Her pressure got so low her blood quit running through her organs.
I didn't even like the guy.
I just... I didn't want to be left out.
About? What, you think I read your messages?
It's a gift, reading upside down.
The Las Vegas District Attorney is reportedly...
against Benjamin Corey Jennings in the so-called Burial Murders case.
Jennings has been in police custody for the last...
Guess we know what she was calling about.
...since he was caught burying the first victim, Oliver Dunne in the National Forest.
Don't you have enough cases over at CSI now you're going to start telling me which ones I should take to court?
There isn't one piece of evidence that says that kid was even present at the murders.
As a matter of fact this is why I was hunting you.
Jennings brought it in about an hour ago.
Chain of custody; I can't touch it.
The first victim was ligatured, right?
Jennings says his little brother asked him to hide the tie.
The older brother brings it in explaining why his epithelials are all over the murder weapon.
A jury doesn't understand epi-whatevers, okay?
They understand a twisty tie and blood all over Ben's car seat.
Oh, come on, Grissom, they're both part of it and if I can get one of them, I will.
He hero-worships his brother, but he's a good kid.
Then his epithelials shouldn't be on that tie.
Explain how bits of your skin got on the ligature used to strangle that victim.
Your brother brought this in to the District Attorney.
Unless you can tell us how your epithelials got on that tie.
I... he... I just picked up the bodies at his place.
Grab that guy's tie, little bro.
You get into any trouble you don't have to say anything, all right?
Yeah, yeah, man, I'm there all the way.
how does somebody bury two bodies as a favor?
He told... He told me that if I didn't talk...
to you guys and if he didn't talk, then this would all just blow over; it'd all just go away.
You're looking at two counts of Murder Special Circumstances.
The best you can hope for is life without parole.
I don't... I don't think I can do that kind of time.
Do you have any physical evidence linking your brother to the murders?
I know that we've arrested the wrong brother.
He came to see you as soon as Ben was in custody.
I tried to help without breaking my vows.
We both have jobs that begin after the crime.
Some people would call that a career in futility.
100 years ago we didn't have the technology for fingerprints.
15 years ago, we didn't have DNA.
Hopefully one day, we'll have foolproof means by which to put the right man in jail in this case.
I believe in God, in science...
I don't believe in rules that tell me how I should live.
Even if they're handed down by God?
How many crusades were fought in the name of God?
How many people died because of someone's religion?
You still suffer like a Catholic.
Light bulb goes out other people fix it, get a new one.
Light bulb goes out for the Catholic he stands in the dark says, What did I do wrong?
That guilt's not in me anymore.
You're going to be getting a call from the local papers about spa safety.
We had a victim die of an allergic reaction at the Mediterranean.
So what am I supposed to say?
That it was an isolated incident...
that in no way should it be a mark against the Strip's other fine hotel-casinos.
Hold his head! Hold his head!
Out of the way! Sir, step back.
We're losing him, we're losing him.
